com.example.lab3_restapi.fragments

Class WeatherFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • com.example.lab3_restapi.fragments.WeatherFragment
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    WeatherDailyFragment, WeatherHourlyFragment, WeatherLiveFragment

    public abstract class WeatherFragment
extends Fragment
    This class is the base class for the other forecast fragments and contains utility methods for those classes.
    See Also:
    WeatherLiveFragment, WeatherHourlyFragment, WeatherDailyFragment

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected android.os.Handler update_weather_data_handler
      Used for setting up a callback to retry updating weather data if the view for a fragment isn't available.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WeatherFragment()

      • update_weather_data_handler

        protected final android.os.Handler update_weather_data_handler
        Used for setting up a callback to retry updating weather data if the view for a fragment isn't available.
        See Also:
        updateWeatherData(Context, ArrayList)

    • Method Detail

      • updateWeatherData

        public abstract void updateWeatherData(android.content.Context ctx,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<APIData.WeatherData> current)
        Method implemented by all fragments to update their display values with the latest forecast data.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context used to setup the retry callback
        current - the new forecast data

      • timestampToTime

        public static java.lang.String timestampToTime(long timestamp)
        Convert a UNIX epoch timestamp to a time formatted string.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - the timestamp to convert
        Returns:
        The formatted time (XX:XX A.M/P.M).

      • getDirectionFromAngle

        public java.lang.String getDirectionFromAngle(double angle)
        Convert an angle in degree to a cardinal direction. From Reverend Gonzo's answer.
        Parameters:
        angle - the angle in degree
        Returns:
        The abbreviated cardinal direction (N, NE, etc.).

      • formatDecimal

        public java.lang.String formatDecimal(double d)
        Format a decimal number to one decimal using the DecimalFormat class.
        Parameters:
        d - the number to format
        Returns:
        The formatted number with one decimal maximum (or none if that decimal is zero).

      • getIconID

        public int getIconID(android.content.Context context,
                     java.lang.String iconRef)
        Retrieve a weather icon ID from the drawable folder using the icon's name. The naming convention for the icons is the same used by the OpenWeather API.
        Parameters:
        context - used to get access to the resources
        iconRef - the name of the desired icon
        Returns:
        The ID of the icon resource.

      • loadTextViewDrawable

        public void loadTextViewDrawable(android.widget.TextView tv,
                                 int drawable_id,
                                 int color_id,
                                 java.lang.String side)
        Set a drawable to the specified side of the TextView and fill it with the specified color.
        Parameters:
        tv - the targeted TextView
        drawable_id - the drawable ID to add to the TextView
        color_id - the color ID for filling the drawable
        side - the side where the drawable should be displayed (one of start, top, end or bottom)
